forumNotes.author: LuigiL
forumNotes.content:
Please help, I am very new to all this but I was able to follow every step and get my usb to boot setup, but when I choose my C: drive i get this error message:
" The following value in the .SIF file used by setup is corrupted or missing: Value 0 on the line in section \[sourcedisksfiles\] with key "sp3.cab" Setup cannot continue. To quit setup press F3 "

what should I do?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Please help, I am very new to all this but I was able to follow every step and get my usb to boot setup, but when I choose my C: drive i get this error message: > >
> > " The following value in the .SIF file used by setup is corrupted or missing: > > Value 0 on the line in section \[sourcedisksfiles\] with key "sp3.cab" > > Setup cannot continue. To quit setup press F3 " > >
> >
> > what should I do? I would suspect that you have value 0 in section \[sourcediskfiles\] with key "sp3.cab" either corrupted or missing. :smile:
Which source did you use? How did you slipstream SP3 to it? Which options did you choose when running USB_MultiBoot_10? etc., etc... While pondering about the above questions, take some time reading Rules, "Common Sense Advice" within them, and expecially point #d: [http://www.boot-land...?act=boardrules](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?act=boardrules "External link") For the moment, only possible reply is standard reply #32 ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png): [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=2587](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=2587 "External link") jaclaz
